2SiSgU2rcAmZFml0pwGDLA.text: Capital Grille is my favorite high end steakhouse, they have the consistency in service and food quality of Outback Steakhouse with justified prices for the quality of their steaks and decor.  Very nice ambiance, very friendly staff, you can't go wrong if you don't mind opening up the wallet or pocket book for a solid dining experience.    My vodka martini's are always very smooth and my steaks are always cooked to perfection.  I end up over eating because everything is so good that I reach a Zen-like state of "food enlightenment."  Also the bar area is great for dates to share a bottle of wine and order appetizers.  My date knew the bartender who was extremely friendly and attentive and gave great wine recommendations.

6dlQm_ZXsqtiPPKomAK0UA.text: Had dinner tonight at Capital Grille. First of all we were almost 40 minutes late for our reservation. We called 15 minutes prior to arrival to inform them and they were very accommodating even though the restaurant was packed when we arrived our table was ready and the service was impeccable.  The bone in ribeye had the perfect marbling which meant the flavor was delicious. I also recommend the au gratin potatoes and please save room for the amazing coconut cream pie.

hsC9RZNCGYdh93F6j0F9YQ.text: Excellent service by John Harris, enjoyed the evening and the atmosphere... Great lobster and scallops... Great lamb chops and all details of our evening was just nice  Welcoming floor managers and we were seated instantly on a Friday night honoring the reservation was an important nice quick first impression of our dinner. Thank you.

hwfTnsj1WSS7up9ClUlwiA.text: This place is exceptional! On 7/7/17 my family and I were celebrating 2 birthdays, and Derek, our server, made the celebration memorable and remarkable. Derek explained the menu items with skill and detailed how each menu item is prepared with scientific specificity. In addition, Derek decorated the table with stars, presented 2 birthday cards to us, and brought us a refreshing tomato, watermelon, cucumber salad. This was a special Birthday appetizer that was on the house. After we finished our entrees, Derek continued the Birthday celebration by bringing us specially prepared desserts. These desserts were: a chocolate gluten free cake and a cheesecake that was everything and more. The manager, Brad, was very friendly and personable. He greeted our table several times throughout the dinner. I highly recommend The Capital Grille. Make sure you ask for Derek when you make your reservation.

AtYl3HKqz2E3fgj6Undgbg.text: I am very very disappointed! I have dined at another Capital Grill location in Texas previously and was very pleased with that experience so this past weekend my husband and I were attending a marriage retreat seminar and our "project" was to plan a romantic date night. I chose Capital Grill in hopes of a wonderful romantic dinner together. The atmosphere is nice, but it was very loud, not sure if this is typical as the was the first time we dined there. The service was excellent but the food was mediocre at best and absolutely not worth the outrageous prices. Our bill was $176.00. We each had a fields green salad (my husbands salad did not even have a salad dressing and we had to wait to get dressing to pour on it) I had the salmon (which was raw and had to be sent back to be cooked more) we had one side, Au gratin potatoes that were not good and we didn't even eat half between us both. My husband had the "special" filet mignon that he ordered thinking that because it was the "special" it would be better priced. This definitely wasn't the case as it was $64, but I do understand that this was our fault we didn't ask for the price. The problem was, as the steak wasn't bad, it definitely wasn't anywhere close to the best steak he has had and absolutely not worth the price. We tried not to allow this to ruin our night, but, sadly it kind of did. I was so disappointed in the meal, then to see the tab for a meal that was not good was extremely disheartening. I NEVER write bad reviews for anything as I typically take things in stride, but this was a little over-the-top

QfM4ApRDBMvnFutLoPEccQ.text: I had never been to CG and decided to indulge myself a little while out of town on business. After a brief conversation with a foodie friend, I was directed to CG over Ruths Chris for a good steak experience.   Food: 1 Star   For fancy steakhouses, I only have Flemings and Mortons to compare to. I also have the wise words of my father who always told me that only poorly cooked steaks need steak sauce.   I've been to Flemings several times and every time it's always come seasoned perfectly. At Capital Grille in Charlotte, to my surprise and disappointment, I got a $60 bill and an unseasoned, tasteless steak to show for it. I did order some bleu cheese crumbles to go with it but it didn't mix well either. I ended up using the bleu for my mashed potatoes which made those a total hit!   But to goto a fancy shmancy steakhouse where you (or your company) is charged an arm and a leg and they can't even properly cook your steak for you is just criminal. I am assuming my problem was remote and hopefully only a local problem but it left a bad taste in my mouth for the next time I goto a nice steakhouse.   Service: 4 Star   Service was great, but obviously, who cares if you get crap at your plate?

lzs3ig9SE5geu-hWiRzAEw.text: Are you kidding me?! This place has the most amazing lobster Mac n cheese IN THE WORLD. Honestly I don't think I've ever tasted anything, in my life, that tastes this good. It's just unbelievable. You cannot live one more day without trying this. Please go. I just want you to be happy so go eat the best Mac n cheese ever. PS- everything else is delish here too. Perfection- this place is perfection.

Odh16y1UJ_6wtliL2XbWPA.text: this is one of my favorite places ever to have food and wine. They are an awesome establishment with top-notch service especially from Sherry and Joe and Edith and Order. Everything is great here. Top notch. You're never going to go wrong with their specials any of their steaks which are limited for good reason because each one done to perfection. Were there salmon or seafood. All of their sides are amazing it's hard to choose if you're unsure you can go with the lobster mac and cheese which is so delicious like a desert. I enjoy the opportunity to have a wine locker here as well and they treat all of their guests with white glove service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outdoors!

AEurc9TOkrP7dDgfViImag.text: This is a very classy atmosphere, fine dining and the staff are superb. I had the pleasure of trying out this location over the weekend. There was no wait & we were greeted with by courteous staff. I have had the privilege of tasting some great food in my lifetime but I usually feel as if I got my money worth. Im sad to say that although the experience was top notch and enjoyable, the limited menu options, the crowded seating space, the astronomical price gouging and taste needs improvement. I can say that I've tried this place but unfortunately I don't think I would return , strictly for the PRICE!

awptu8MBsrQjN6aO_JfR_A.text: I've wanted to try this out for years based on what people have told me. I was looking for a top quality steak that I would remember as one on the top of my list. So we finally got a chance on an invite with another couple during Queens feast this weekend. I was nearly totally disappointed with the food that we were served.   The steaks "the 5 of us that had steak at our table agreed on this" were a mere "OK" as far as quality and taste. There wasn't any flavor other than just meat flavor on the filets that my wife, sister, daughter, and myself got. They were cooked to the correct temperature we asked for so that was good. The 5th person got the aged NY strip with bone in steak. I was able to try it and agreed with him it was lacking flavor also. The appearance of the food was nice but nothing we had lived up to the fame I've been presented with over the years.   I gave 3 stars based on the food vs service. Food was nothing to desire again. Service was great, Brandon was our server. He was on point with presenting the menu, drinks, clean up, etc.

qJFBRGLPp2otr0F3QGEP3A.text: Love this place. Every time I go the food is amazing. The service was great but this time unfortunately my salmon was a bit over cooked. The clam chowder is everything and served with crackers. The lobster Mac and cheese was amazing as well. Nice and clean setting with complimentary valet. Great place for gatherings and date night!!

OWCgPm_p4xXi_NT2m8SBQQ.text: It took me over a week to review this place, not because I forgot but because I needed the words to do this establishment justice...and I still might not give it what it deserves. This place is phenomenal. The food was excellent and I now totally understand the pricing of this place. Luckily for me I made reservations unbeknownst to me that it was restaurant week. So we got a three course meal for a low price. I would absolutely pay the regular price since this place is well worth it. From the beginning of my reservation the staff was ready and on hand to help me execute the day. I was planning a surprise dinner for my Honey and from the cupcakes, to the roses as well as the confetti scatter, everything was how I asked them to present the evening(except they didn't sing). The food was seasoned all the way through...and the drinks were super strong. We also had complimentary champagne. I will definitely go back since the 13 year wait was worth it. I don't know how long this place has been in existence but whatever the price I'll gladly pay!!! Oh and I couldn't give it Five Stars since I didn't check out the bathroom(pet peeve) but I'm pretty sure next visit it'll be updated!!

p39TdYzGUtYf-TU688CpBQ.text: Loved this place! My boyfriend took me here for our anniversary dinner. There is complimentary valet which was wonderful! We made a reservation for 7PM and were seated promptly.   We arrived at a table decorated with little pink hearts and a happy anniversary card with a hand written note! Joe S. was our waiter and his service was delightful! He wished us a happy anniversary and brought two glasses of complimentary champagne. We also ordered a bottle that he served us.  For our appetizer we had the calamari. Amazing and full of flavor! I got the swordfish with crab on top and it was perfectly soft and delicious. My boyfriend for the filet mignon with onion and mushrooms and it was a perfect texture and taste! We also shared a half order of the soy glazed Brussels which were savory and heavenly! The soy flavor was strong, while not being too salty.  We also got an adorable complimentary dessert! Everything from beginning to end of this experience was great and we are excited to come back again! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted Swordfish
Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dessert!

noBPkuLzYS--isxaaK3_qQ.text: I am glad that I came back to The Capital Grille last night for dinner with my best friend. It has been about 3 years since my last visit here in Uptown Charlotte.  Of course Capital Grille never disappoints!  Perfect location in Uptown with a parking garage 1 block away. The Staff here are always courteous and attentive. I don't mind the prices as long as the food is top-notch and we have great service. We chose to dive right in with entres and 2 sides. My friend chose the 22oz Bone-In Ribeye and I chose the Chef's Selection Porcini Rubbed Bone-In Ribeye with 15-year Aged Balsamic. Wow!  Both steaks were seasoned well and flavorful!  I must say I was the hands down "Winner Winner Steak Dinner" with the Chef's Selection Ribeye!!  This preparation with the Porcini rub and the Balsamic is out of this world and I am glad I went for it!! Oh did I mention the sides, we chose 2 sides to share: the Lobster Mac n Cheese and the Au Gratin Potatoes!  Both are excellent sides but the Lobster mac n Cheese was exceptional tonight with the right balance of cheeses and cream.  I usually don't do doggie bags here but we both wanted the full experience and we decided to stop the feast at bag it for tomorrow and go for desserts!  So for dessert I had the Warm Double Chocolate cake with Port Wine infused Cherries and a scoop of vanilla ice cream sand my friend chose the Capital Grille Cheesecake Brulee Style with berries.  Both were just down right sinfully great!!  We were both completely satisfied from our culinary escapade and couldn't stop talking about the great food here!  The Capital Grille  earned the 5 Stars  Tonight easily!! Thanks!  I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cocktail at The Capital Grille!!

ZG9Aa2GzuRmtMV5RIWQPIA.text: Always incredible. Was our coworkers birthday and everyone made her feel extremely special and celebrated. Will always recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oysters on the half-shell with a birthday celebration

ZS8D1uqwO0P7lJOObys_uw.text: I have a confession to make. I really like a nice cut of red meat.  I like it medium rare and I like it to melt in my mouth. I know The Capital Grille is a chain but it never disappoints. Sometimes I pop in just for their signature stoli doli drink and calamari.  But sometimes I go all out and have the full meal.  This time I went during Charlotte Restaurant week and ordered from the special menu.  We skipped the calamari this time because we knew how much food was about to arrive at our table. We also took part in their "generous pour" offer.  It was 3 courses of 3 samples of wine. Approximately a 3 oz pour each so it really is a great deal if you want to try out something new.   So for my appetizer I decided to try out the clam chowder. I usually opt for the salad but I saw such good reviews bragging on the clam chowder I had to try it out for myself. It wasn't the best clam chowder I've ever had but it was quite good. Had lots of clams in it!  I continued my meal with my love affair with medium rare filet. It was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. It came with whipped mashed potatoes and green beans . The beans were a little too al dente for me. Actually, they tasted like they weren't even cooked.  And finally, we finished up with both the flourless chocolate cake and he creme brulee. Skip the cake and get the brulee!  It's a fancier restaurant uptown. We went right before a concert at Spectrum. Be sure to make a reservation. There was actually a wedding proposal there that night.  If you don't want to spend the cash on their expensive month, check them out during restaurant week!

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Creme brûlée
Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sam&#39;s Mashed Potatoes

XuVlSRtlmPJCu21FhhEsGQ.text: Fine dining at its best. Everyone here is so polite, it was our 6 year anniversary and they even had little hearts sprinkled on the table along with a card. The Chef prepared us two separate special items due to it being our anniversary which I thought was very nice. Everything served was absolutely delicious. The sides are definitely for two so if you're not a big eater I'd def split the sides with your date. The prices can be a little pricey but it's worth every penny spent. Overall great experience cannot wait to come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dessert cheesecake and chocolate cake
Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese

rE8uj2LZIZDLI3zi6EvbGw.text: I was only in Charlotte for one night and I'm glad my coworkers and I found this restaurant to eat. Ambience is great, service was fantastic and the food was top notch. I ordered a boned filet and it was cooked exactly to my taste and met all my expectations of a great steakhouse. The mashed potatoes were packed with flavor and the asparagus was cooked just right.  I highly suggest that you save some room for the cheesecake creme bulee. It is a typical cheesecake but has the top crusted like a creme bulee. This was one of the best desserts I've had.

RCk13PgUue5JatcOA_H6eQ.text: High end chain fare. The capital grill is done well, with all the standards you'd come to expect from a fine dining restaurant. High end fare adorns it's menu and an upscale environment welcomes you as you walk in. Service is also done well and what you'd expect of an establishment at this price point. Food quality is good if not excellent. I do like the capital grill but at this price level I think there are private restaurant options out there that are run by some very good chefs.

MQPG_9IhoHT97t-ZT-Vf0Q.text: Been here a couple of times, and I have to say they are very consistent. Food is very good, and if for some reason it's not; for any reason they will make it right. It's a bit on the pricey side, but being a steakhouse in uptown Charlotte it's expected. I've had the bone in strip with the coffee run as well as the ribeye both dry aged and very tender. The strip came out a bit over cooked and when I mentioned it to our server he insisted the kitchen make me another. The service is superb and they constantly want to make sure you are happy and the food it exceeding expectations. On the surprising side my favorite dish to date was actually their burger made with Pat Lafreida's blend of short rib and brisket with caramelized onions...just drooled a little typing that.

MOiTsQVLE8c-icGilbgqaw.text: What can you say about The Capital Grille that you don't already know.  The appetizers are fantastic (Calamari and shrimp cocktail are an absolute must,) delicious steaks and other entrees wrap up a delicious meal.  Perfect for a working lunch or a romantic dinner, Capital Grille is always a solid choice.

xUBjxeCbgWjP_Z2VVW4uyg.text: Brought my mom here 2 weeks agofor a late mother's day/birthday lunch, and everything we ate was superb! This is what I call fine dining! Our waitress Angela was AMAZING! Her service was an easy 10/10. The lunch menu is a bit cheaper than the dinner menu. I ended up paying $80 for our food, which was well worth it! Either way, if this is going to be your first time dinning in at a very upscale restaurant such as this place, be prepared to spend more money than what you'd normally spend at a dine in restaurant. The food is worth every penny, I assure you! After our meal she surprised my mom with two free desserts for her birthday! We will definitely be back!

MqInssRTo4-P3c9jDf6DVw.text: Haven't been to The Capital Grille in a while but I am so happy we decided to go there. Our server Ryan was great. He listened to what we wanted in a wine and offered a great suggestion. He was knowledgeable of the menu and items. He made sure we always had everything we needed and made sure our table was always clean of bread crumbs, empty glasses etc. He described the items on the menu we were questioning in great detail. Our food and service was perfect. We look forward to returning soon. Thanks.

pq3y51vgSTYLoi3Mt3u1Pg.text: This is probably my top 3 steakhouses in Charlotte! If you're going to splurge and want to be extremely satisfied do it here. From the ambiance to the 5 star treatment this place takes the cake. The steak that I had was delicious and tender. We also love the Brussels sprouts here. Just thinking about it makes me want to go back sooner than later. What more can i say but it's one of the best and you will not be disappointed.

KvSmk2syLJBuPGGNjlaeig.text: Very good service. Very good food. If you enjoy a good steaks and wine. this is the place for you. Will bring my in laws here for there anniversary.

etU_hKh18iEP9NAkQLvAow.text: Great venue and location. It's right uptown and conveniently close to the Discover place, which I liked. The food was very delicious except I felt they overdid the cheese with my Maine lobster butter sauce and the lobster Mac N Cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

JB5KHD2OTUhWViNBUFEbJA.text: Came here to celebrate my daughters graduation and I must say this place had Exceptional service. Food was delicious! And the presentation, divine. If you love steak, this place is for you.  If you love dessert, this place is for you.  If you love wine, this place is for you.   I'm telling you, you will not be disappointed. So I recommend you make a reservation ASAP

PbYUyZR37ArpOsy-hoWXUg.text: Pretty expensive but a wonderful atmosphere and delicious food. I went with a group of 10 people and our server waited on us hand and foot. A friend in our group was pretty drunk when we got there, but the server was so patient and even laughed at his antics ( not that he was terrible, but a bit loud and constantly making lame jokes). I don't think there was anything anyone got that they didn't love. I had oysters on a half shell and a cup of clam chowder soup. Both were delicious. My husband had a steak which he devoured, plus we ordered 3 bottles of wine. Yikes! Definitely a big bill, but it was our friend's birthday so we had splurged a little. Will go here again for sure. Maybe we will try to not drink so much wine though next time. (it cost almost double compared to what you would pay at total wine or grocery store).

Shs7ME-M29rYG_n1qkFCng.text: I don't go often, a couple times a year (strategically timed for Restaurant Week and Waygu & Wine) but when I do go, it's great. Cap Grill will not knock your socks off with innovative food or design but you should know that before going in.   I've had excellent service, weather in the bar or the dining room, by myself or with a group a friends. Personally, I prefer the bar, I'm a casual diner and get unduly nervous anywhere I must speak in hushed tones and remember which fork to use.   The food is precisely cooked and well presented. I enjoy starting with the calamari. It's mixed with fried peppers, so you might be getting squid or hot pepper; unless you're careful it's a surprise. The aioli is a must.   This is the place for a steak (medium rare). And also the home of one of the best burgers (med rare) in town.   Dessert is great - I usually opt for the flourless torte but honestly every thing I've tried has been excellent.

4KckjzCs9eD0Hxvdg6rGFg.text: Pro: The food was delicious and the restaurant is beautiful. Very upscale..You can smell the luxury and money coming in/out the restaurant. No wait time, no reservations needed as we just popped in for lunch. We were seated rite away!    Cons: food came out luke warm. The server was not attentive, and I'm not sure why as the place was not busy at the time. Lest just say his tip went to the other server who had to pick up ours slack. If you don't earn it you don't get it.

q_yYsSropfE99FT5rlKS4Q.text: Really good steak. Friendly wait staff. Everything is al a cart, so a little expensive. Would definitely go back!!

Smef058j_eRAg7V3XKr-7A.text: I love this place! Capital grille is one of my favorite restaurants! It has amazing steak, lobster macaroni and cheese, appetizers and salads! My favorite salads are the steak cobb salad and the lobster salad (pictured). They are both so amazing. Also the bread is delicious. Great ambiance, service, and food! A must try if you're in the mood for a delicious steak dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster salad!
Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak Cobb salad!

jxO8qMXyGIxPa8vK-ZVEJw.text: Had a great dinner for three. Waitress was suburb. Had drinks first then a great French wine upgraded by the som. Had a fine bone in filet prepared as ordered. Other steaks also just as ordered. Usual side were as excepted. Great service, food and wine make for a perfect evening. Nice cream brulee to finish

J8ZFcAQZ_X9abiLi9guGFQ.text: Sometimes you have to choose a spot for a special occasion. Last night was one such night . We choose The Capital Grille to celebrate our 39th anniversary and we were not disappointed. Our waiter Rob was amazing and the food was great. Thank you for a wonderful and memorable evening.

3vNXrOmTHWW5JvV3rB16Jw.text: My business colleagues and I stopped here for Dinner last night.  We arrived at 6 at got a great booth in the main dining room.  Since we are CG regulars, there was no need to look at the menu.  We ordered  Old Fashioned Whiskies, Filets, Creamed Corn and Coconut Cream Pies for Desert.   That was it........pure bliss!  This is another fabulous CG location.  The Decor, food and service was awesome as usual.  The Managing Partner Armin Ahrabin was a great host.  CG rocks in Charlotte!

iCQGn6Ee73OEdpJ_TiEUpQ.text: Ending my three days in charlotte with a superb ny strip steak with simply astonishing flavor. This place serves an elite steak that would hard to equal or best anywhere. I have never been impressed with the sides steak houses serve and The Capital does not distinguish itself in this area either. The Malbec they carry by the glass was well above average (Catena 2013) and the chocolate icecream a True winner. I rarely visit steak houses but was glad i decided to risk it this time. Memorable!

Hdz7RJlX7LUUblNG0y3-ZA.text: Just to let everyone know the capital grille is doing a steak & salad special. They have three different options of salads and steaks to choose from. I got the spinach salad with fire roasted tomato and house mozzarella. I forgot was how my steak was prepared but I got it cooked medium. I paired it with a grapefruit buck cocktail because it was the lunch hour after all. One of the many reasons why I'll keep coming back is the older Caucasian lady that works there. She's so upbeat and has the best customer service skills.

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak salad medium  w/ champagne  vinaigrette chat: POWERFULAPACHE
Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Medium steak with spinach salad.

vyPb13_2u82u5CxlyxweQA.text: By far the best steak house in Charlotte! Met our two daughters Friday after Thanksgiving for a lovely dinner.  10 oz filet was cooked to perfection with crab meat of equal flavor and ample quantity. My favorite side is the creamed spinach but the lobster mac and cheese is also amazing and loaded with lobster. My daughter had the crab lobster cake appetizer as a meal. Two four ounce cakes so generous she took one home. The tomato and mozzarella salad was fresh, tasty and had high quality balsamic to add to the flavor.  The wine list was expansive and high tech! Our server Amber was by far the highlight of the night. So professional, helpful, available, and yet not intrusive. We stayed several hours yet never felt rushed! We had more left overs than the Thanksgiving dinner and you can already guess what leftovers were eaten first! Great experience in every way!

qdkS54bXxmlUYOGqIdptXA.text: One thing I love about this place..  is David.  He's an awesome server and make sure to look after  your needs. Foodwise.. They  have the best steaks. I love their creamy clam chowder... The ambiance  is so relaxing. Very quiet.

YrQlyy-f4Mv3HvdIQeXqaQ.text: Was in the area on a business trip and this is where my group ended up after a long day.  I'm not a big fan of the NYC midtown location but this one was actually a pleasant experience. They didn't scoff at my steak black and blue request, actually the server agreed that a  great steak should only be eaten that way...kudos to you man!  Attentive staff yet unobtrusive.  My water glass was filled every time it went half full.  Our waiter also remembered our drinks and would just bring another without prompting once he saw the glass was almost empty.    Would definitely go back to THIS location!

4Z63ZIFbUcKIslAPojJbaA.text: No matter where you are, you can always depend on a capital grille to be top notch in every aspect. Came here on a trip to Charlotte, and just like every other capital grille experience, it was pretty much perfect.   I had a card for a free appetizer from a capital grille in Philly, so I was able to to use it at the Charlotte location for a free appetizer. I ordered the calamari and as always it was delicious. In addition to this they give you a plate full of freshly made potato chips that are delicious. Between both of these it made for a perfect happy hour along with their awesome rum selection.  The service at this location was extra good being that there was a hint of southern hospitality added to an already great service experience. The bartender was quick, attentive and kept the drink glass full after seeing I was getting low. Great experience and I look forward to visiting the next Cap Grille in a different city.

gzkDQLhtIuTrmj1Y4mIovA.text: First timer to The Capital Grille, decided to check them out for Restaurant Week and we were finally able to score a reservation!  We arrived early so decided to have a drink at the bar, but that turned into 2 drinks and ouch our tab was expensive! I wish we had been running late instead!  We were seated right on time for our reservation - this is very important to me - I hate when restaurants make you wait more than 10-15 minutes to be seated.  Our waiter greeted us promptly, explained the Restaurant Week menu and showed us the regular menu and the wine list. We both wanted to try the RW menu - I had the filet and my husband had the bone in Kona crusted sirloin. We also had salads and sides for the table. Dessert was creme brulee and flourless chocolate cake (both = yummm).   The food came out quickly (maybe too fast?) and our waiter checked on us just the right amount. The food was very good. Not quite up to my favorite steak restaurant (Del Frisco's) in terms of quality of food or atmosphere. But the service was excellent. It just feels outdated in there and the steak wasn't that melt-in-your-mouth quality that I want from a high-end steak house.  I am glad I tried The Capital Grille and I would go back - but it probably wouldn't be my first choice for an exquisite steak in Charlotte.

ho09nHEfLCzrymTeGaqreA.text: Me and my husband loved our dining experience here. We started off with the calamari which was delicious and served with buttery hot peppers.  Me and the hubby both ordered the NY strip steak and agreed that it was one of the best strip steaks we had ever had. The flavor and texture was perfect. The sides we chose were also very very good. I had the green beans which were very flavorful and my husband tried the truffle fries again super good though a little low on the salt per my taste.   Their desserts were also quite good. The berries with creme anglaise was as good as berries with creme can taste. The hubby had a flourless chocolate cake that was quite decadent. Overall superb service, great decor/ambiance and splendid food.

EAJ8qL9Eb3VB-KSYehKurA.text: Last time we ate here it was a year ago. Very refreshing to go to a restaurant and it consistently delivers on the experience. The bone in filet melted like butter on every bite. Very pleased with the meal and looking forward to the next time.

jGfZlYwS9YsH0VBGskJQcQ.text: Love love love!! First off, the lobster bisque was amazing. The fresh and large chunks of lobster were mouth watering. I then had the filet sandwich with truffle fries. The filet had a Capitol Grill special sauce that was a mix between a goat cheese spread and aioli. The truffle fries were hands down the best I have ever had. Nothing even compares. The filets were perfectly cooked, as were the fries. The artichoke bisque was also fantastic. We were able to sit outside in the financial district of Charlotte, which is beautiful. Definitely a must go to if you are in the area.

5wUl9oJ7Pb6fn21w3tZowA.text: Disappointing ... I really enjoy The Capital Grill most times and this experience left a poor taste for the Charlotte location. Our service and the food was, at best, two-star. I know I did not have the steak but typically I can count on this chain to deliver a good meal - if not great (my last visit in Downers Grove, IL in December was fabulous).  When we were told we could not get a table for an hour we decided to sit at the bar.  After about 15 minutes the host said he could seat us - we should have been suspicious at this point. We went outside to our table that had trash and leaves around the edges of the patio (hey, wait they didn't just blow there last night).  Our tablecloth had stains and spots on the silverware.   It took a good 15-20 minutes for our server to come take an order after bread and water were dropped. We asked to start with the fresh mozzarella, tomato, and basil with 12-year aged balsamic. When it arrived it was two neat stacks on one plate and one empty plate. When we asked the server why it was not split his response was "we can't split this salad." Ok - not as if we asked to split an escargot- the salad was almost perfectly portioned for two. Not to bother we just shared. The sliced tomatoes were mealy and flavorless and only one leaf of basil per stack. There was a nice marinated grape tomato as a garnish but I didn't pay for a tasty garnish.   The main course we tried the grouper special. I've had better. The grouper was ok (notice the theme) but the shrimp that came with the special was overlooked and tough. Our sides - sauteed spinach and the wild mushrooms were good. We ordered a 1/2 order of both which is just perfect for two people. My only comment is we pulled eight whole cloves of garlic out of the spinach before eating it. Vampires beware ,,,  Our drinks were never tended too and the front server never bothered to follow up on the salad. I hope everyone inside had a better experience.

OIR2KWUxPD7W_RzYD9aPUw.text: I have been here twice now so I think I am able to give a good overview. Ironically, both times I had George as a waiter (a nice asian gentleman)...he is HILARIOUS, and a great waiter. So shout out to him.  Pros: Everyone is super friendly, accommodating, etc. PARMESAN TRUFFLE FRIES Great wine by the glass selection fast service Super nice waiters  room for improvement: I ordered my steak Med Rare and it was most certainly rare. VERY rare. (I know some people don't know what Med Rare, or Med, etc really means, but I do.) Wedge salad= waste of money. Not really good, bulky to cut/eat.  Overall, I will def come back, especially because it's super convenient for my client. I would expect a steak place to cook a steak to my requested temperature and if I had more time I would have probably sent it back to be cooked more.

ARjq0sBksaXaK-iAiyC3LA.text: Went in to grab a drink with a friend prior to a show. As usual, the vibe and atmosphere were top notch. One of my favorite things about This bar is the immediate water upon sitting and chips! Such a tasty little snack!   I must commend Luis on this visit. He was so nice and answered all my questions! a definite gem and the kind of person that makes us choose to come back! So thankful for this place to catch up with friends or enjoy a delicious meal and very thankful for great staff like Luis who make it welcoming and a pleasant visit!

YjCON6eFKVmnAhLDilYsZA.text: I dined at the Capital Grille for a weeknight dinner. It was busy for a weeknight, good for them!   The decor and environment is 5 stars. It looks beautiful and luxurious!  The food was very good. Then menu is decently large with several options that sounded great. I ordered the scallops and was very happy with my choice.  The service was not bad but also not out of this world great. Maybe it was an off night for our server, who seemed like a seasoned professional when we first sat down, I don't know. We asked for limes with our sparkling water that never were served, asked for butter that had to be requested again, and a salad came out incorrect. Everything was taken care of once we mentioned it, I just feel like at a place as luxurious as this you should not have to say so many reminders to service. But with all that said the service was good and this experience would not keep me from dining here again.

XYJjqto17W33xLGuP4C7zw.text: I have come here many times over the years... Mostly for working lunches.  Today, I decided to come with a coworker and NOT work during lunch.  We were greeted immediately, and seated shortly thereafter.  Once at our table, we were promptly served water and handed menus... and then we waited... and waited... and waited... You see, I think the issue was that no one designated a waiter to our table, AND we were tucked away a bit...  Finally, Ryan Rudisuhli saw us and asked if we'd been helped... upon hearing a "no" from us, he became instantly apologetic and extremely attentive to the point that we were served complimentary clam chowder before our entree salads and dessert afterwards for our wait.    I must say... the teeny tiny hiccup aside... we were VERY well cared for here.  My salad entree had the seared salmon with mango, avocado, and tomato salsa... my coworker had the caesar with shrimp.  We had a great lunch, everything was so well prepared, and our waiter, Ryan, was an absolute gem!    If you're looking for a good place to treat yourself to a nice lunch uptown OR just need a cool spot for a business meal, the Capital Grille is ALWAYS a good staple in uptown Charlotte!

Bz2th-rTp_K76FDr12VZUQ.text: I'm a firm believer in.... you get what you pay for. By no means am I the richest person in the world but every once in a while I like to splurge. But let's be clear the service needs to match the price point.   We had the best experience from start to finish!! The bartender David was absolutely AMAZING! He   Was friendly from start to finish. The Stoli Doli was amazing.  The food.... WHEW!!! The lobster and crab cakes, mashed potatoes, asparagus, bone in Kona NY strip, sea bass, and cheese cake were ALL amazing.  The manager John came over to introduce himself and chat us up about the cheese cake. It's great to know that our sentiments about the cheesecake are shared! The server Mario was friendly, funny, and just the right amount of attentive without being overbearing. I definitely recommend this place for not only the food but the service, ambiance, and overall experience!!

UqPHZK3w1Gcx4ai6-kzBDQ.text: Got stuck in Charlotte on our Anniversary and wanted to find a steakhouse so we could at least eat good . And stumbled across The Capital Grille on Yelp. Well this had to be the best decision I have made in a while . We had a fabulous waitress named Ashley who had awesome recommendations with the sweetest personality. Everything we ordered was fabulous . Great flavor and I just so happened to come during the summer wine event so I got to try some great wines which Ashley gave great descriptions of ! Make sure u try this place if in North Carolina and my fingers are crossed that u get Ashley as your waitress!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

F1sEaR-IayjZXeBcWu3uPQ.text: We were here for Christmas Eve dinner, and although we've been here before each time we discover something new that we love.   Upon arriving there was someone standing outside the door to greet us and hold the door for us. Even though it was quite chilly out, he still had a warm smile. We were shown to our table immediately upon entering which was a cozy half moon shaped booth. The waitstaff was excellent which I look forward to with each visit.   For appetizer, we ordered the lobster and crab cake. It was served with a cold corn salad which was really tasty. We planned on sharing them, but soon realized that we needed to order ourselves another round. I ordered she crab soup and my husband ordered the new york strip. We were too stuffed to have a dessert on this visit, but next time for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Crab Cakes

NVOyTciv0bpnN7OSqy34bQ.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!  Capital Grille is officially my New favorite restaurant Uptown! I've lived in Charlotte for close to 10 years and this was my first time dining here.  My experience at this establishment was wonderful from start to finish. The ambiance and service were all excellent! Sunday, I came for a group outing which started at 6 PM, I choose to have a drink at the bar beforehand. As always, I'm a big fan of ANY establishment with purse hooks under the bar--these details matter, friends! The wine selection is great, I ordered a glass of the UpperCut, Napa, Merlot, 2013. Shockingly smooth and rich!  Now let's talk about the food! My friends and I had the pleasure of dining inside the private "Exchange Room" which sits outside of the restaurant. This room is perfect for special events and gatherings, the setup is beautiful.  Our group enjoyed a lovely four-course dinner with shared apps, sides, and desserts from the Sunday Butcher & Baker Menu. Here's a list of everything we enjoyed:   (Shared Apps) Calamari Crabcakes Procuttio Wrapped Mozorella  Chef's Seasonal Salad - Bibb lettuce, mixed baby greens, radishes, baby carrots, heirloom tomatoes with parmesan vinaigrette. The parmesan vinaigrette is DELISH  The Butcher's Choice (we got to select one) I ordered The 16 oz  Capital Grille Prime Rib Medium well - This item was served with roasted bone marrow. Possibly the BEST Prime Rib i've ever had!   Double Cut Cheshire Pork Chop-Slow roasted with honey and whole grain mustard glaze topped with crispy onions.  Salmon Wellington en Croute-Roasted wild mushrooms, sauteed spinach, and horseradish creme fraiche.  (Share Sides) Sam's Mashed Potatoes Lobster Mac & Cheese (LOVED, Cheesy goodness) Soy Glazed Brussels Sprouts with Bacon (LOVED)  (Shared Desserts) Warm Apple Crostata w cinnamon streusel and housemade vanilla ice cream Cheesecake, Chocolate Cake, and Creme Brulee  All of the food was delicious with no flavor overpowering. I look forward to dining at The Capital Grille again very soon. There are lots of specials during the week. Thank you Capital Grille for a wonderful experience.

PU0zJeyUPMuH4UaxU4rPcw.text: Took advantage of Queen's Feast to visit Capital Grille January 2019. Dining at the Capital Grille was a most enjoyable experience. We like the cozy, elegant ambiance. Our a Server , Sherry Webb, was most informative, helpful, polite, sweet and friendly.  The food was perfectly made. Our calamari was lightly breaded with a kick of peppers. There were some hot peppers that will wake your palette. The salad was tossed in the perfect amount of dressing.  The clam chowder was creamy with some small diced potatoes, the cup was the perfect amount. Our steak and salmon was perfectly cooked. The mashed potatoes were amazing, one of the best I ever had. The green beans were ok, not our favorite.   Our desserts close our night with a highlight. My husband and I were so impressed with our server.   We will definitely be back.

gD4b-Ylzt8iWZc_H6zFT8g.text: Excellent food, excellent service. I highly recommend the Lobster bisque and the Bone in Ribeye. A+++++

photos.caption: Photo of The Capital Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bone in ribeye was to die for.

TKsMeddvJy-ebbQQCZrHeA.text: Our first visit to The Capital Grille will definitely not be our last.  Everything from the initial greeting to our dessert was far beyond our expectations!  We were fortunate to have as our waiter: Alex Fu. He was AMAZING!!  Be sure to ask for him when you dine at The Capital Grille!

jpQs7-WlongUogE1NYXjbw.text: I don't even know where to start.  This was my first visit to The Capital Grille and wow.  Amazing.  I'm kicking myself because I can't recall the name of our server and he was a straight-up ninja!  I don't know how he did it, but he refilled our glasses before we even noticed we were low.  (If management reads these reviews - we were a private party of about 35 on June 15th.) One person at our table kept receiving water refills from someone else that didn't know she actually had Sprite, but our water replaced the error each time before she took a sip.  He brought out the club soda and napkins for another member of our party when some food made it's way onto her shirt.  He was AMAZING.  Then...there's the food.  Oh man.  Seriously.  What didn't I love?  The Capital Grille can even make brussels sprouts amazing, kudos to them!  The grilled asparagus and roasted wild mushrooms were divine too.  Did I mention the insanely gigantic Grand Plateau?  It had crab, lobster, shrimp, and oysters.  My steak was done to perfection and was so big there was no way I could finish it.  And don't forget about the desserts.  I loved them all - the classic creme brulee, the flourless chocolate cake, and the cheesecake.  Get it all!  I can't wait to return to The Capital Grille and just writing about it is making me hungry for it!

nN2xkfS5qgQzbyFcblxWGw.text: Food, drinks and service were good. Order from specialty drink menu...blackberry bourbon was banging.  Must try lobster and crabcakes, ribeye and creamed spinach.  Classy,  upscale option. Dress is trendy from blazer and jeans to suit and ties...either way you can't go wrong.

UohNZVM4UK88956HGHFTIQ.text: Always a great dining experience when I visit the Capital Grille and the location in Charlotte, NC is no exception.   The bar was bumping with a lively crowd but the bartenders had everything under control.  As usual, an excellent wine selection with a full bar with beer.  The atmosphere was not stuffy but what I call casual elegance.  The service was excellent especially from our server Shawn. The lobster bisque is my favorite with chucks of lobsters.  The bone-in ribeye was cooked to perfection and tons of flavors.  We added spinach and au gratin potatoes which complemented the food perfectly.  The coconut pie closed out an excellent dinner.

o8tc1mzH6ChiDIIUY2XgIg.text: Went on a date here with my boyfriend and ate outside. It was great scenery and the staff was very prompt. We got water as soon as we were sat; and then our drink order was taken. I tried lamb for the first time and wasn't a huge fan, despite me denying that I had made s mistake, our waitress noticed that I wasn't enjoying my meal and replaced it. This is definitely the best place in charlotte (so far) for an exquisite dining experience.

Hr-Ho3OTR_L51hblcVx1oA.text: Spendy, but worth it in every way.  I got a gift card for the Capital Grille, and honestly its the only way I would have gone, just because I'm on a budget.  But I have to say it was a fantastic experience and I am already trying to figure out how to justify eating there again.  I only had a selection of small plates and a drink, but what I had was spectacular and our server was amazing.  Even though we were clearly a bit out of our element, I never felt like our service was less than what anyone else got, which was really nice.  I would consider this one of the best dining experiences I've had in Charlotte and would recommend it for anyone celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a fantastic dining experience.

yZ7G95G41x_jzZ0R6bjdpw.text: Went while visiting Charlotte, happen to be restaurant week. Didn't make reservations but the hostess where amazing and got us in. Celebrated a friends birthday, we really enjoying the service and food. I had the clam chowder soup and salmon with added lobster. Lobster wasn't worth the upcharge but everything else was good.

g9-Z3OFrYylaYvc6twZPmA.text: What can I say... It's a 5 star restaurant for a reason. From service, to food, to Ambien. 5 Star All The Way! I've only eaten here for lunch in the past. If this was my first time getting here for dinner. My wife took me out for my birthday and wow what a treat!  The raisin bread and onion bread are a must! The butter had a firm cheese-like consistency and was extremely flavorful. For drinks, my wife had reisling and I had two cocktails. My first was the "In Fashion" and this was by far the STRONGEST cocktail I've ever had in my life. It had the perfect blend of bourbon and bitters that just made me want to smoke a cigar. My second drink was the grapefruit Fire and Ice which had two different tequilas and was infused with Fresno peppers. Spicy but delicious!  I had the lamb chops and they were delicious. I got them well done and very few restaurants know how to do this without burning them. Lamb chops are the only things I have to eat well done. He came with a cherry reduction sauce however so it was very good and wasn't necessary. The lamb chops were seasoned to perfection. My wife and I shared the potatoes augratin and the sauteed mushrooms. These were some of the best mushrooms I've ever had. So I've only been here for lunch I can't wait to come back for dinner. Everything was amazing!

0q7PTJgrSs7Mzk6jaUWPSw.text: I made a reservation the night before and requested a private booth. I was shocked when I arrived and they had a private booth waiting. Typically when I do that at restaurants, they never read the special instructions. Especially when it comes to seating. When we arrived the restaurant was really nice and clean and we were seated almost immediately.  The menu was very easy to understand and we really enjoyed having a lot of options. We ordered the crab and lobster cake appetizer and it was delicious. So delicious my husband did not want to share, but I made him. Ha! There were two crab and lobster cakes along with chilled corn.   I ordered a glass of Riesling which was delicious. It was semi sweet and I loved it! For dinner, I ordered the bone-in New York strip with Gorgonzola on top. It was absolutely amazing. We also ordered the mushroom as a side and the potatoes au gratin. Both were equally amazing.  The manager came over towards the end and address me by name and asked if I enjoyed everything. I really appreciate it that! It was very personable.  After dinner, they bought us two small desserts. The creme brulee cheesecake was amazing.   The restaurant was pretty pricey but it was worth every dime.

YdBLChmprEnCXCq0A0CIog.text: First time at a capital grille, overall great experience. For a high end restaurant, it's about what I thought it would be in terms of food and service. Had a reservation and was seated promptly. I want to say we got very lucky and had an amazing server (Mithoon) who knew the menu perfectly, had a great sense of humor, and was very personable.   As for the food, table starts with assorted breads and butter, Fiji bottled water and sparkling bottled water. I started with French onion soup. Very good but I was hoping for something different/better, not that it was bad, but honestly average. The Caesar salad I thought was delicious and light, and I enjoyed their style of croutons (not box kind).  For the main course we shared a dry porterhouse, without seasoning, just salt, cooked medium rare. I thought I was excellent and cooked perfectly. If you want to enjoy it, you need some sides. Top recommendation is lobster Mac and cheese, one of the best  I've ever had. Other great sides are the o'graten potatoes and mash potatoes, I prefer the regular mash, so creamy and perfect with the porterhouse. If you like brussel sprouts, I also highly recommend them; it's a soy based sauce and there's nice chunks of bacon in there that are heavenly. The mushrooms were just okay, not a wow like the rest.  For desert, tops is coconut cream pie, and I'm not even a huge coconut fan, but you must try. Double chocolate cake takes second, kind of like an open lava cake, comes out hot, and with the vanilla ice cream you got a hell of a nice desert. Also tried the flourless chocolate cake, it's super rich and in the hard side, not creamy at all but delicious. This is a great gluten free option.   For the wine drinkers, they have a nice cellar, but it's byob and they charge a corking fee, and they bust out the decanter.   Free valet outside the front entrance, otherwise street parking. Clean bathrooms, great staff, I would come here again!

8FaVIEjCKcMf_6Kpoci2Hg.text: My honey took me to this restaurant for my birthday. First off the complimentary valet was a major plus because uptown can be a nightmare. We were greeted and seated promptly (we did have a reservation). The wait staff was very professional and attentive throughout dinner. We did order from the bar (there was a full bar) however I felt like we needed to order from their drink menu. The wait staff did not seem confident that my boyfriend could get the drink he wanted the way he wanted it.   I ordered the salmon, mushrooms, potatoes au gratin. My boyfriend had the roasted chicken. The food was good overall. The mushrooms could have used a little more seasoning but the potatoes were delicious!   Oh I forgot to mention that the table was decorated nicely with confetti and a card from the restaurant for my birthday. Very nice touch!   I did get a complimentary dessert for my birthday and the waiter even offered to take our pic!   I would go back for sure but special occasions only because it was definitely pricey but it is upscale so that's to be expected!!!

uvd1kNCwOWhLkvyNde6zvQ.text: I made a reservation on a Wednesday to enjoy a splurge date with my wife. We wanted to enjoy the Queens Feast, a 3 course structured meal. I walked in by myself, the wife was still parking after waiting 10 minutes out front for a valet attendant. To her disappointment, the valet service is after 6pm, but you do not know that until you walk up to the valet podium to see the sign. I politely waited about 10 minutes for a hostess to seat me & the wife arrived a few minutes later after parking in a garage that didn't feel safe to her. Sherry was our waiter & was very pleasant as well as informative. The food was good but not unusually spectacular & it did arrive in a reasonable time. The bill appeared high for the structured Queens Feast, but we attributed it to the second glass of wine she had. With the lighting so dim & the receipt print faded we paid the bill with the intent of checking it at home. After walking my wife to her car in the shady parking garage near by she drove me to my car parked in the street. Once home we reviewed the receipt  to discover a 3rd $35 Queens Feast was charged in error. I called & was transferred to a manager I assume that apologized & assured me it would be credited. I'm not sure who's error it was, but Sherry now gets tipped on the overcharged bill & walks away with a bonus percentage on an already fair 20% while we are merely given an I'm so sorry... we will gladly return to Del Frisco's & Ruth Chris for our future uptown steakhouse experiences.

R0tBo22TFzU5fGPQO7Fg3Q.text: I eat at Capital Grille quite a lot, however, my last experience a couple of days ago was not the best.  I ordered a special order for a fish burger made with sea bass.  When I received the bill, it was $31.00!!!!!.  When I questioned it, Peter said he would go and rerun the bill for a regular fish burger but then came back and said "they said the reason is you are paying for an entree". The waiter Peter did not tell me that I was paying the price for an entree. If I had known, I would have ordered the entire entree and not PAY $31.00 for a &?**! BURGER AND FRIES!!!  UNACCEPTABLE!

ecfAFLzUzM46UNmP-lZ7GA.text: We went for an early dinner, 3pm, and the restaurant was not busy. Our wait staff was professional and courteous, but the food was nothing to brag about and hardly worth the $300 tab (no wine or alcohol). There were five in our party and three of our steaks were not done as we asked. Mine was cooked to the right color (pink center) but it was not hot! I mean, this is a steakhouse, you should NEVER have to send your steak back... The grilled asparagus was excellent as were the garlic mashed potatoes. But that is not what you go to a steakhouse for. We will not be returning.

0LZCs3GRROXQgcxQhoHQaA.text: I have always been a fan of Capital Grille, but my recent experience was a huge disappointment. I ordered a filet medium rare, which came out super dry, with almost no flavor at all. I asked for grilled onions with my steak, and received what looked like a dried out, halved onion that had been on the flat top for a few seconds. The spinach was not evenly cooked (some came out looking like spinach salad, and some parts were wilted), and was not flavorful. My husband's scallops were also dry and overcooked. The lobster macaroni was pretty good, but overall, the food was exceedingly sub-par from what I have come to expect from Capital Grille, and what their prices are. It was the kind of meal I would expect from Applebees. Del Frisco's is a much better fine dining experience in Charlotte.

wH_pA9G6FT8JxLuQdCySRQ.text: Not a good experience!!  The server staff isn't up to par with what a high end steak place should be. First the server argued with me when I asked about the Kona Steak and stopped him once he said coffee was in the rub. He said you can't taste it and I said I dislike coffee a lot and I probably would and he wanted to argue about it. Second, the staff came and took our plates and appetizer before we were done with it and we had to get up and track him down to get it back. Third, the side and steak came out about 10 mins apart. Fourth, the medium rare I requested came out blood red and cold it was so rare. Fifth the lobster mac had shell pieces from the lobster that I thought cracked a tooth it hurt so bad. Sixth, the server hands the bill to someone other then myself even though my name was on the reservation. All in all this was a VERY BAD experience at one of my favorite steak houses. Worst part about was I was trying to close a deal with clients and the bad service was the topic of conversation instead of my closing.

wf1wwWPkLR_8KAdx6YxxMg.text: The total package:  top flight service, ambiance, food and wine.  Highlights:  Oysters and shrimp cocktails paired with Champagne. Sliced filet with onions and mushrooms paired with "The Prisoner" red blend.  Server:  Joshua... new, but enthusiastic. Helped make the evening enjoyable.  Two thumbs up!

DUWz7uPfWaASOPGJWF2-MQ.text: Seriously amazing experience from the second we walked through the door / attentive and concerned / meal was fantastic / service, WORLD CLASS
